original_title: Sri Lanka, India ECTA deal talks to be wrapped up by March
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Technical talks on an Economic and Technical Co-operation Agreement between Sri Lanka and India is planned to be concluded by March 2024, Minister Bandula Gunawardana, who is cabinet spokesman said.
According to an update provided to the cabinet by President Ranil Wickremesinghe, the next round of talks on the ECTA will take place in India from January 08, 2024.
The 12th round of talks between negotiators from Sri Lanka and India had concluded in November.
Negotiations are conducted by the Department of Trade and also a unit coming under President, Minister Gunawardana said.
Sri Lanka was keen to expand international trade and prevent another economic crisis, he said.
